doc.after: The Chinese government claims Taiwan as part of its territory and officially refers to all Taiwanese aborigines as Gaoshan, which are one of the 56 ethnicities officially recognized by China. According to the 2000 Census, 4,461 people were identified as Gaoshan living in China. Some surveys indicate that of the 4,461 Gaoshan recorded in the 2000 Census, it is estimated that there are 1,500 Amis, 1,300 Bunun, 510 Paiwan, and the remainder belongs to other tribes.
